title: Youre a <removed>
body: This is a legitimate summoner name. How come someone cant have "Riot" anywhere in their name without the name being denied but %%%, ngr, spic, %%%, are all PERFECTLY ok and the system isnt designed to reject those names on the spot?

replies.body:
You can report players for having inappropriate summoner names.
The reason for people not being allowed to have "Riot" in their name is so Riot employees can be easily identified.

> [{quoted}](name=Votable Jester,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=gEOocr8a,comment-id=0002,timestamp=2016-07-07T04:09:09.009+0000)
>
> You can report players for having inappropriate summoner names.
> The reason for people not being allowed to have "Riot" in their name is so Riot employees can be easily identified.

This here is exactly my point. They have a program in place that can deny summoner names based on a sequence of lettering, in this case R I O T, in any part of the name in that four letter sequence. F A G, F G T, N G R, S P I C are all ok but R I O T isnt? Its pathetic that the solution is to just "report" a fucking lvl 30 with over 1600 games played who apparently ISNT being dealt with. His name is LITERALLY youre a f g t.
Filters inevitably prevent people from having legitimate names. Let those players get punished for their poor choices, and not hurt the ones that are innocent.

I mean, having "Riot" in your name can cause gameplay issues.  "youre a f g t" may be offensive, but it won't make people assume the person has some power or can ask for profile info.

I do agree that those names shouldn't be allowed, but it would require a bit more work to list possible alterations for every insult.  Reporting is far more reasonable as an individual can examine the case and determine if the name should not be allowed.
It's funny because the people with Riot in their name play their game more than the Developers do.

Because there simply too many ways to write a word differently. The more of these ways you ban, the more creative people get.
It's simply a lot easier to leave it to people to report people for offensive names.

Edit: Another problem is how some context can make things more acceptable.
As an example: If no names that contains "spic" were allowed, I couldn't take the name "despicable" for no real reason.

It is not acceptable, just report them. It is impossible to cover all  the various ways to rewrite ethnic slurs and offensive language through an automated system. Just report them and do you part instead of complaining that others don't do theirs (when they are in fact doing more than you are).

you're toxic, however, this is a damn good question, and wish someone with more credibility would repost this.

For a company, which has so much pride in regards to their 'automation' and algorithms, it's a little odd that a filter is not in place at the summoner name creation level.
im not quite sure what %%% is

well apparently its not OK for the boards HOWEVER, it is perfectly fine in summoner names
Is it really so crazy to think that got through the filter? Report it and it will get delt with.
It's probably due to how the boards are coded for summoner names but idk.
